definition: Company is majority-owned by Chinese entities, individuals, or the Chinese state, subjecting it to Chinese data laws and potential government influence.

criteria.description: Majority ownership (>50%) by Chinese individuals, companies, or government entities
Headquarters or primary operations in mainland China
Significant investment (>10%) from Chinese state-linked funds or entities

counterCriteria: Company has legally divested Chinese ownership
Operations have been fully relocated outside China with verified data separation
